A Story of Beer And Friendship
It  all started in October of 2000, when Rick moved into a new neighborhood  and was walking his dog.Â  On the walk Rick noticed a house with the  garage door open, and it had carpet on the floor, a dart board, a sit  down video game that looked like PacManâ„¢, a TV playing the Gator game,  and a refrigerator.Â  But thatâ€™s not what stopped him in his tracks that  sunny Saturday.Â  No, it was the TWO tap handles attached to that  refrigerator.Â  Home keg systems are pretty common these days, but in  2000 it was a rare find.
Excited  about his new neighbor, Rick walked his dog back and forth in front of  Andyâ€™s house until he came out, to which he ran up to Andy and blurted  out, â€˜HI!!! MY NAME IS RICK!â€
It turned out that Rick and Andy had a lot in  common, with the biggest thread being home brewing.Â  Over the years they  brewed beer in each otherâ€™s driveway,Â  joined the
Dunedin Brewers Guild
together, and spent a lot of time talking about and drinking good craft beer.
But  their fate wasnâ€™t sealed yet.Â  Rick threw a little house keg party the  following Memorial day weekend, and had a huge turnout.Â  The Â½ barrel  blew within the first hour or so.Â  Luckily Andy was there, and Rick  asked him what he had on tap at home.Â  He said he had most of a keg of  Anchor Steam flowing.Â  And Rick said, â€œCan I borrow it?â€.Â  Andy said,  â€œSure!â€, so they grabbed a hand cart and snagged the keg out of the  fridge, and brought it to the party.Â  At that moment in time, Rick knew  he had a friend for life.Â  Anyone who will loan you the keg out of their  fridge is the type of guy you can trust.
Over the years they talked about opening a  bar. What two guys drinking beer hasnâ€™t done that?Â  But as they visited  breweries, tap houses, craft beer stores, and numerous beer events they  picked up little ideas for things to do ... â€œSomeday"
Then  one day, out of the blue in the summer of 2008, Andy called Rick and  said,Â  â€œWhat are you up to these days?Â  I think itâ€™s time we open the  bar weâ€™ve been talking aboutâ€. Timing could not have been better, as  Rick had recently sold his business, and wasnâ€™t real sure of his next  direction.
Andy  was working in the Real Estate market, at one of the historically worst  times in the last 50 years.Â  Once the decision was made, it didnâ€™t take  long to open the first, and very humble little HOBâ„¢ in about 350 sq  feet of useable space. â€œ40 Taps, and 13 Barstools, Any Questions?â€, was  on the first shirt.Â Â And they proudly boasted that they had more taps  per square inch than any pub in FL.Â  Since no one questioned them, it  had to be true
Andy Polce and Rick Clemo opened the Dunedin  House of Beer Taphouse in February 2009 and quickly became one of  America's Top 100 Beer Bars.
Both avid homebrewers, it was just a matter of time before the HOB started producing Excellent Beers of their own. Â With  over a decade of experience bringing craft beer to the masses, the HOB  Beers were designed and created with maximum likability and appeal.
In  September 2019, They opened an Expansive Outdoor Patio and Recreation  area, HOB Brewing Company, directly off the beautiful Pinellas Trail. 24  taps, typically 22 made on site, a cider tap and a guest tap. We also  offer wine, a great array of hard seltzerâ€™s and canned cocktails.
And  in December 2020, They expanded once again by adding on a Two-Story  Event Pavilion for Parties, Weddings, Live Music and More!

8 Ball Aitken has toured the world for more than a decade performing his swampy-blues-rock across twenty countries to date. Heâ€™s earned a loyal fanbase from his live shows and internet videos, while paying his dues as a singer, songwriter, slide-guitarist, and producer.
8 Ball moved to Nashville, Tennessee, USA in 2012 and worked for nine years with many of the best in the blues business today. He won second place in the 2021 International New Orleans Cigar Box Guitar Festival hosted by blues woman Samantha Fish.
8 Ball is back with a brand-new blues rock album â€˜ICE CREAM MAN 2â€™ that hit #1 in the Australian Blues & Roots Charts in June 2023 and had 4 number #1 AMRAP Chart hits. This new 12-song recording was mostly completed in Nashville right before he re-located back to Australia. Itâ€™s a highly anticipated follow up to the first â€˜ICE CREAM MANâ€™ album that also hit #1 on the Australian Blues & Roots Charts in March 2021.
8 Ball Aitken produced â€˜ICE CREAM MAN 2â€™ himself. The cast of musicians include Grammy winning drummer Tom Hambridge (Buddy Guy), saxophone legend Buddy Leach (George Thorogood & The Destroyers), Sydney soul singer Taya Chani and 8 Ballâ€™s younger brother Dillion James Aitken on Hammond organ and piano. 8 Ballâ€™s partner Jessy Lynch also sang backup vocals. Jessy & 8 Ball welcomed their new baby boy â€˜Sonny Miles Aitkenâ€™ into their musical family earlier this year.
